question: Which drugs are included in the CABENUVA pill?
ideal_answer: Cabenuva contains cabotegravir and rilpivirine. It is used for treatment of HIV.

snippets.text: Cabenuva™ is recently approved by Health Canada containing LA cabotegravir+LA rilpivirine nanocrystals (ViiV healthcare) for once monthly administration by intramuscular route.

A regimen comprising extended release injectable suspensions of cabotegravir and rilpivirine for concurrent administration (CABENUVA™) is being developed by ViiV Healthcare and Janssen Pharmaceutica (Janssen) as a complete regimen for HIV infection.

The clinical phase III trials of FLAIR and ATLAS, showed two-drug injectable cabotegravir (CAB) and rilpivirine (RPV) formulation is potent, safe, and tolerable in HIV-infected patients. The recent approval of cabenuva (CAB+RPV) by Health Canada is a milestone in the development of long-term therapies for HIV infection.

Cabenuva-an injectable formulation of cabotegravir and rilpivirine and the first injectable complete therapy for adults with HIV-1-is now approved.It is administered once a month as two intramuscular injections following a month of treatment with the oral forms of these drugs.
Cabenuva™ is recently approved by Health Canada containing LA cabotegravir+LA rilpivirine nanocrystals (ViiV healthcare) for once monthly administration by intramuscular route.

The approval of the novel long-acting HIV injection; Cabenuva®- Cabotegravir and Rilpivirine injectable formulation) and the recent call by the World Health Organization for promoting community-based ART management, underscore the remarkable progress towards meeting the Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS) 95-95-95 targets by 2030.
The recent approval of cabenuva (CAB+RPV) by Health Canada is a milestone in the development of long-term therapies for HIV infection.
